application.doc: Retrieving all trace components and status

param.name: id
param.doc: Name of the instance to act on, which is a unique name that identifies the instance

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieving all trace components - Reverse Proxy Server
method.doc: To retrieve all trace components and status with the web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the Reverse Proxy tracing resource URI.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

response.doc:
HTTP response code and JSON data that represents an Array of Hashes, where each hash contains key and value pairs for:
[ { "id": "pdweb.snoop", "name": "pdweb.snoop", "level": "9", "file_size": "512", "flush_interval":"30", "rollover_size":"1024000", "max_rollover_files":"5" "compress":false }, { "id": "pdweb2.snoop", "name": "pdweb2.snoop", "level": "5", "file_size": "1024", "flush_interval":"40", "rollover_size":"9999", "max_rollover_files":"5" "compress":false }, { .... } ]

representation.name: retrieveTraceComponentsRvsProxyJsonResponse
representation.doc: Note: Response body is an array.

param.name: level
param.doc: The current tracing level for this component. Valid values are integers 0 - 9, where 0 indicates that tracing is not enabled for the component.

param.name: file_size
param.doc: The current accumulated size of the trace file and all rollover trace files for this component

param.name: flush_interval
param.doc: The number of seconds between the flushing of cached records to the log file. If not specified a default flush interval will be used.

param.name: rollover_size
param.doc: The maximum file size (in bytes) before this file is rolled-over. If not specified a default rollover size will be used.

param.name: max_rollover_files
param.doc: The maximum number of rollover files to be kept on disk. If not specified, all rollover files will be kept.

param.name: compress
param.doc: Whether the rollover files should be compressed. If not specified the rollover files will not be compressed.

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
